author: mrfwashere
content:
I don't think it can be solved, but there are still two use cases for this channel:

1) reports from trusted users
2) reports against clear impersonators (made obvious by account name)

discord recently added ability to disable DMs from non-friends on a server by server basis, maybe that can be recommended in reply to other cases

author: potuz
content: A cursory look at this channel shows that most reports are from regular users, so a good rule of thumb would be to just ban reports from users you recognize. This at least would force spammers to be a little more interactive in looking for users that are online but do not post often
